resources.string: Search by case name or modules
Check Utils functionality in Util module
Check SwitchManager functionality in Util module
Error occurred. Please, try again later or contact technical support.
Error on server occurred. Please, try again later or contact technical support.
Access denied. Please, restore access or log in again.
Refresh token is expired or invalid. Please use password to continue
User is unauthenticated. Please, log in.
Connection failed due to SSL Handshake error. Please, connect our technical support.
Connection failed due to unknown host exception. Please, connect our technical support.
Timeout exception. Check your network connection and try again.
No connection. Check your network connection and try again later.
Server is unavailable. Try again later.
Application inner error occurred. Please, try again. If problem still occurs, contact our support.
Request was not authorized. Retry or connect our technical support.
Parameters was not set completely. Retry or connect our technical support.
User has no additional authorization types.
Decryption failed, try to enter manually
Decryption failed, try to enter manually
Decryption failed, try to enter manually
Password recovery failed. Please, check inserted info and try again.
Activation failed. Please, check inserted info and try again.
User was locked out due to exceeding the limit of authorization attempts. Wait few minutes and then try again.
Reactivation error. Try again later. If problem still occurs, contact our support.
Registration error. Try again and if problem still occurs, contact our support.
Phone you are trying to set is already taken.
Email is not confirmed. Confirm your email.
Email you are trying to set is already taken.
User name you are trying to set is already taken.
Password format is incorrect. Please enter another password
Email was not added. Please, try again.
Email verify was not successful. Please, try again.
Email was not deleted. Please, try again.
Phone was not added. Please, try again.
Phone verify was not successful. Please, try again.
Phone was not deleted. Please, try again.
Phone is not confirmed. Confirm your phone.
Entered code is invalid or expired. Check if the code is correct or request a new code accordingly.
The user account is not activated.
Case 1. When you open this screen, the keyboard are immediately shown and EditText view below has focus. Use button on the right side to defocus view and hide keyboard

Case 2. Use Show button to show keybord, but EditText view on the center will not have focus. Use Hide button to hide keyboard. If EditText view will have focus and you will use Hide button, keyboard will be hidden, but EditText will have focus
Case 1: Number entered in the input field below formatted into integer or fractional number with two decimal signs without mathematical rounding. To convert use the Format button.
Case 2: Number entered in the input field below formatted into fractional number with minimum two decimal signs. To convert use the Format button.
Case 3: Add something in the input field below, and get only numbers and dots from string you added using Format button(Example of a valid card - 4111 1111 1111 1111)
Case 4: Luhn algorithm check. This only works if you are certain all input will be at least 10 characters

Case 5: Add card number and get card type using Card type button. 
- Mastercard - first four numbers are in 2221..2720 range or first two numbers are in 51..55 range and the length is 16 
- AmericanExpress - first number is 34 or 37 and the length is 15 
- Visa - first number is 4 and the length is in 13..16 range 
- Unionpay - starts with 62

Switch manager from the Util module is created for handling enabling and disabling views. With the first custom switcher you can enable/disable views using the basic SwitchManager from the module(Base SwitchManager can handle EditText views and views that implements ISwitchView interface), with the second one you can do the same but with the overridden SwitchManager(this manager can handle all views like a base manager and also Buttons and SwitchCompat views).
Base SwitchManager can enable/disable view if it implements ISwitchView interface or if it is an EditText
Custom SwitchManager overriding base SwitchManager and also can enable/disable view if it is a Button or SwitchMaterial
*Here EditText and CustomSwitcher with Test title will be enabled/disabled
Before become isChecked switcher checks for a non-empty field below. Enter something in the input field and turn on the switcher
Use this switcher for enabling and disabling views on the screen. Switcher is on - enable views, off - disable
Create your own CustomSwitcher. Use functional below to add characteristics and style to your view.
Add paddings to switcher\'s info text:
Use this switcher to enable/disable views on the screen
Case 1: Listheader view with title, icon on the right. Click on container to open/close list below. Use Add button below to add more text view to Listheader
Case 2: Listheader view without title, icon on the right is clickable
Case 3: Listheader view with title, clickable action text on the right and clickable container

Create ListHeader with functional below. Created Listheader is clickable and in its container will have TextViews which will be shown or hidden. Remember: when you add action text action icon becomes invisible
Case 1. Topbar without any icons, but with divider
Case 3. Topbar with navigation icon and actionView on the right, with handler for handling clicks
Case 4. Topbar with action icon on the right
Case 5. Topbar with actionView on the left
Case 6. Topbar with actionView on the left and actionIcon on the right. Use button below to change title, actionView and action icon, with handler for handling clicks
Case 7. Topbar with actionViews. Use button below to change style of Topbar
Case 8. Topbar with actionView on the right
Case 9. Topbar with two icons and two actionViews, but icons are not visible cause actionViews are in priority, with handler for handling clicks
Case 10. Topbar with two icons, with handler for handling clicks
Case 1. Cardline with icons, cardValueAlignment inherit, two dividers, all paddings and default title width percent
Case 2. Cardline with end icon, cardValueAlignment center, two dividers, text style and title width percent 0.1
Case 3. Cardline value without title, icons, top divider and with long text, cardValueAlignment textEnd
Case 4. Just title with long text, no dividers
Case 5. Cardline value with fixed height, dividers and all parts have different vertical bias. You can use button below to change cardline style
Create your own Cardline. Use functional below to add characteristics and style to your view.
Add vertical bias for title and value text:
Case 1: Pin view with a base style. Use buttons below to add/restore pin items or clear all added pins.
Case 2: Pin view with a custom style. Animation time to fill pin is 1 second, to unfilled pin is 0.5 second. Use buttons below to add/restore pin items or clear all added pins.
Here will be your Pin view
Add amount of cells and cells size
Add time in mls for cells animation in/out
Create your own Pin view using functional below
Create your own Message Dialog. Use functional below to add characteristics and style to your dialog.
Can\'t show an empty dialog. Add a title, or a message, or buttons, or list of items.
Add something with the length from 1 to 20
Use this bottom dialog to send entered data to Fragment. If you click on Send button and entered data is correct the dialog will be closed and you will see Toast message with entered data.
On this screen you can see BottomDialog fragment and check it\'s functionality. Open dialog from fragment using first button and open from view model using second button.
On this screen you can check functional of InputfieldView and see different styles of views.
Case 2: Custom InputFieldView with two icons, label, help text. When you set error box stroke, label and start icon will have error color
Case 3: Custom InputFieldView with styled box, start icon mode checkable and end icon mode custom. When you set error only box stroke will have error color
Case 4: InputFieldView with start icon mode progress and end icon mode text. When you set error box stroke and end text will have error color
Case 5: InputFieldView with icons. Error color will be the same for each parts of view but icons will have default color.
Case 6: InputFieldView without icons. When you set error only box stroke will have own error color
Click this buttons to set/reset errors to all inputField views
On this screen you can check functional of InputfieldView end icon.
Case 2. InputfieldView with end icon in Clear text mode
Case 3. InputfieldView with end icon in Password toggle mode
Case 4. InputfieldView with end icon in Custom mode
Case 5. InputfieldView with end icon in Text mode
Case 6. InputfieldView with end icon in Checkable mode
Case 7. InputfieldView with end icon in Error mode
Use buttons to set and reset errors for all Inputfield views
Use this button to change end icons styles for all Inputfield views
On this screen you can check functional of InputfieldView start icon.
Case 2. InputfieldView with start icon in Checkable mode
Case 3. InputfieldView with start icon in Custom mode
Case 4. InputfieldView with start icon in Default mode
Case 5. InputfieldView with start icon in Progress mode
Use buttons to set and reset errors for all Inputfield views
Use this button to change start icons styles for all Inputfield views

Go to another fragment using two buttons. With first button you can navigate without args, with second button navigate and pass entered in field data. \nTo go back to menu use system back button or button on app top bar.
Go to second fragment without args
Go to second fragment with args
Received data, if data was sent here:
Use field below to pass data with pop back
To go back to previous screen without args use button below, navigation icon on app top bar or system back button.
To go back to previous screen with args use button below and add data to input field above. Then you will see entered data on previous screen on Toast.
To back to the previous screen and pop back from it too use button below(in this case you will go to Menu).
On this screen you can check different functional of BaseUI module.
Use this button to open message dialog from fragment or view model
Start adding data in input field to make field focusable, than tap somewhere outside the field. Field becomes unfocusable and keyboard will be hidden
Use buttons below to check and request permissions to read/write external storage.
Use this button to request a group of permissions.
*After confirming permissions, you can remove them in the application settings.
Use buttons below to check how viewModel handle error with different types of showing errors.
Use buttons below to check how fragment handle error with different types of showing errors.
Use this case to change app language and theme. New settings won\'t be saved after app closing. Language by default is English and theme is system.

Use this case to check domain use case functionality and play with random numbers. The game is to match the number you guessed with the random number from 0 to range number. \nIf you guess the number you will see congratulations message, otherwise you will see error dialog.
Check encrypt/decrypt AES methods. Add some data to input field and press Start button. You will see encrypt result and decrypt back result.
Check encrypt/decrypt RSA methods. Add some data to input field and press Start button. You will see encrypt result and decrypt back result.

Check:
1. click, click with position (use switcher in the bottom for that)
2. long click, long click with position (use switcher in the bottom for that)
3. add item\(s\) to the end of the list. Enter something into the field below and press "Add item" button
4. delete items. Press on "Clear items" button, it should clear recycler completely
5. set items. Press on "Set another list" button, it should fully replace all items
6. check onItemClick of adapter's ItemViewModel. Each time you click on item, it's counter will increase

Check:
1. click, click with position (use switcher in the bottom for that)
2. long click, long click with position (use switcher in the bottom for that)
3. add item\(s\) to the end of the list. Enter something into the field below and press "Add item" button
4. delete items. Press on "Clear items" button, it should clear recycler completely
5. set items. Press on "Set another list" button, it should fully replace all items
6. check onItemClick of adapter's ItemViewModel. Each time you click on item, it's counter will increase

Check:
1. click, click with position (use switcher in the bottom for that)
2. long click, long click with position (use switcher in the bottom for that)
3. add item\(s\) to the end of the list. Enter something into the field below and press "Add item" button
4. delete items. Press on "Clear items" button, it should clear recycler completely
5. set items. Press on "Set another list" button, it should fully replace all items
6. check item change state to picked
7. check last item visualization (added item in the end has no divider)
8. check item alignment (left, center, right)

Check:
1. click, click with position (use switcher in the bottom for that)
2. long click, long click with position (use switcher in the bottom for that)
3. add item\(s\) to the end of the list. Enter something into the field below and press "Add item" button
4. delete items. Press on "Clear items" button, it should clear recycler completely
5. set items. Press on "Set another list" button, it should fully replace all items
6. check item change state to picked
7. check last item visualization (added item in the end has no divider)
8. check item alignment (left, center, right)
Use these buttons to check how biometric is working. You can open Biometric dialog if biometric is available and check if biometric is available using second button.
Rule: selected date must be between first and last day of current month
Rule: value should be the same as in field above
Rule: value must contain at least 5 symbols
Rule: value must be bigger than 10
Rule: value must be from 1 to 999
Rule: value can contain letters and symbols -+=,!
Rule: value must contain from 1 to 20 symbols
*You can choose different patterns for displaying calendar date using spinner on the right

This case show that ViewModel can save necessary date and recover it after app process reboot. First field save entered data, second not. \nInstructions: in developer options choose no background process in Background process limit. Then open another app and re-open this app from open applications stack.

Use this screen to check TimeParser module functionality. Use calendar for choosing date and different cases below to get selected date in different formats. If you don\'t know how use date patterns, follow the link below to see different pattern examples.
Date in unexpected format. Check entered date and pattern and try again
Illegal pattern characters. Check entered pattern and try again
Unexpected error. Check entered data and try again
Return selected date in UTC format.
Return selected date in UTC format string with pattern. You can set your own pattern and use the Custom Pattern button, or use default pattern (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss).

Return selected date string with pattern and the default date format symbols for the default locale. You can set your own pattern and use the Custom Pattern button, or use default pattern (dd.MM.yyyy).
Return date from entered local date string with entered pattern and default locale. You can set your own local pattern and date and use the Get result button.
Return date from entered UTC date string with entered UTC pattern and default locale. You can set your own UTC pattern and date and use the Get result button.

Use this screen to check Logger module functionality. Usually you can see logs in Logcat, but on this screen loggers are overridden and you can see logs on two recycler containers. Use functional below to create you own logs with tags, categories and messages.
Case 1: To log action add tag and message
Case 2: To log action add tag, category and message
Case 3: Log error with opening Error dialog
Case 4: Log message by showing Toast
Case 1: To log action add tag and message
Case 2: To log action add tag, category and message
Case 3: Log error with opening Error dialog
Case 4: Log message by showing Toast
Do you want to clear all cases test data? You can\'t roll back this action.
Clean token info after click on case buttons
NOTE! Fingerprint is not supported by this device (or no fingerprints added)
Show error on refresh with token
Show error on refresh with secret

Case 1. Refresh access token.\nRenewing the access token in any way possible. If the refresh token is already in the refresher, then access confirmation dialogs are not used. If there are no additional login methods, then a password is used.
Case 2. Check access.\nCheck access by additional login methods or password. Can be used with or without forced refresh of the access token.
Case 3. Get secret key.\nThe encryption secret key is obtained by entering one of the additional login methods, otherwise an error is generated about the absence of additional login methods.

Case 4. Save refresh token.\nUsed to save a refresh token using additional login methods, at the same time it recreates additional login methods. It is recommended to use this method, if there are no additional login methods, and if they are available, it can regenerate encryption keys and the previous encrypted data will be erased or become inaccessible. So when have additional login methods, it is recommended to save refresh token after getting the secret (previous method) and not with refresher method \"Save refresh\".
